# Carga de las librerias y configurar los valores options

```{r message=FALSE}
# install.packages("googleAuthR")
# install.packages("googleAnalyticsR")

library(googleAnalyticsR)
library(RGoogleAnalytics)
library(ggplot2) # For some initial plots.
library(forecast) # for the time series prediction.
library("tidyverse")

```

# Vamos con la primera query de Google Analytics in R

```{r message=FALSE}
## Veamos el listado de los account de GA y la guardamos en una nueva variable
account_list <- google_analytics_account_list()

# comprobamos la estructura
str(account_list)

## visualizamos la columna Vista, viewId
head(account_list$viewId, n = 10)

## se recoge la vista del índice 4 y se muestra
ga_id <- account_list[4,'viewId']
ga_id

```



```{r message=FALSE}

# Create a list of the parameters to be used in the Google Analytics query
# Get the Sessions by Month in 2014
gadata <- google_analytics(id = ga_id, 
                           start="2018-01-01", end="2018-12-31",
                           metrics = "sessions", 
                           dimensions = "date",
                           max = 5000)

subset(gadata, gadata$sessions == 0)

nrow(subset(gadata, gadata$sessions == 0))
```



```{r message=FALSE}
gadata %>%
ggplot(aes(x=date, y=sessions)) +
  geom_point()

```


```{r message=FALSE}
gadata %>%
ggplot(aes(x=date, y=sessions)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))
```


```{r message=FALSE}
gadata %>%
ggplot(aes(x=date, y=sessions, size = sessions)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))
```




```{r message=FALSE}
gadata %>%
ggplot(aes(x=date, y=sessions, size = sessions, color = sessions)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))
```


```{r message=FALSE}
gadata %>%
ggplot(aes(x=date,y=sessions,group=1)) + 
  geom_line() + 
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1)) 
  # some styles to rotate x-axis labels
```


```{r message=FALSE}
# Now we can plot the data points with a trend line added:
gadata %>%
ggplot(aes(x = gadata$date,y = gadata$sessions) ) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))
```

```{r message=FALSE}
# Añadimos la dimensión día de la semana y fecha - solo 1er semestre
gadata_2 <- google_analytics(id = ga_id, 
                           start="2018-01-01", end="2018-06-30",
                           metrics = c("sessions", "avgSessionDuration"), 
                           dimensions = c("dayOfWeek","date"),
                           max = 5000)
```


# Data visualization in R

```{r message=FALSE}
# Añadimos la dimensión día de la semana y fecha
attach(gadata_2)
ggplot(data = gadata_2, aes(x = dayOfWeek, y = sessions)) + 
  geom_boxplot()

ggplot(data = gadata_2, aes(x = dayOfWeek, y = avgSessionDuration)) + 
  geom_boxplot()
```

# Traffic heatmap

```{r message=FALSE}
library("ggplot2")
library("RColorBrewer")

gadata_3 <- google_analytics(id = ga_id, 
                           start="2018-01-01", end="2018-06-30", 
                           metrics = c("avgSessionDuration"),
                           dimensions = c("dayOfWeekName", "hour"),
                           max = 5000)

```


```{r message=FALSE}
# order the data
gadata_3$dayOfWeekName <- factor(gadata_3$dayOfWeekName, levels = c("Sunday", 
                                                          "Monday", 
                                                          "Tuesday", 
                                                          "Wednesday", 
                                                          "Thursday", 
                                                          "Friday", 
                                                          "Saturday"))
gadata_3[order(gadata_3$dayOfWeekName),]

```


```{r message=FALSE}
# convert the data frame to xtab
heatmap_data <- xtabs(avgSessionDuration ~ dayOfWeekName + hour, data=gadata_3)



# plot heatmap
heatmap(heatmap_data, 
        col=colorRampPalette(brewer.pal(9,"Blues"))(100), 
        revC=TRUE,                                        
        scale="none",                                     
        Rowv=NA, Colv=NA,                                 
        main="avgSessionDuration by Day and Hour",                 
        xlab="Hour")
```


# Device comparison

```{r message=FALSE}
gadata_4 <- google_analytics(id = ga_id, 
                           start="2018-01-01", end="2018-06-30", 
                           metrics = c("sessions", "avgSessionDuration"),
                           dimensions = c("date", "deviceCategory"),
                           max = 5000)



# plot sessions with `deviceCategory`
gadata_4 %>%
ggplot(aes(deviceCategory, sessions)) +   
  geom_bar(aes(fill = deviceCategory), stat="identity")

# plot avgSessionDuration with `deviceCategory`
gadata_4 %>%
ggplot(aes(deviceCategory, avgSessionDuration)) +   
  geom_bar(aes(fill = deviceCategory), stat="identity")
```


# Forecasting 26 días


```{r message=FALSE}
library("forecast")
library("reshape2")
library("stats")

gadata_5 <- google_analytics(id = ga_id, 
                           start="2018-06-01", end="2018-06-30",
                           metrics = "sessions", 
                           dimensions = "date",
                           max = 5000)


timeseries <- ts(gadata_5$sessions, frequency=7)
components <- decompose(timeseries)
plot(components)

# note the way we add a column to a data.frame
gadata_5$adjusted <- gadata_5$sessions - components$seasonal

theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))

forecastmodel <- HoltWinters(timeseries)
plot(forecastmodel)

forecast <- forecast:::forecast.HoltWinters(forecastmodel, h=26) # 26 days in future
plot(forecast, xlim=c(0,13))

forecastdf <- as.data.frame(forecast)
totalrows <- nrow(gadata_5) + nrow(forecastdf)
forecastdata <- data.frame(day=c(1:totalrows),
actual=c(gadata_5$sessions,rep(NA,nrow(forecastdf))),
forecast=c(rep(NA,nrow(gadata_5)-1),tail(gadata_5$sessions,1),forecastdf$"Point Forecast"),
forecastupper=c(rep(NA,nrow(gadata_5)-1),tail(gadata_5$sessions,1),forecastdf$"Hi 80"),
forecastlower=c(rep(NA,nrow(gadata_5)-1),tail(gadata_5$sessions,1),forecastdf$"Lo 80")
)

ggplot(forecastdata, aes(x=day)) +
geom_line(aes(y=actual),color="black") +
geom_line(aes(y=forecast),color="blue") +
geom_ribbon(aes(ymin=forecastlower,ymax=forecastupper), alpha=0.4, fill="green") +
xlim(c(0,90)) +
xlab("Day") +
ylab("Sessions")
```

# Forecasting 90 días

```{r message=FALSE}

)
```
